I'm sorry, but the answer provided in your question is not accurate. In the U.S. tax system, which is a progressive tax system, only the income above the threshold for the next tax bracket is taxed at the higher rate. This means if your income increases and you are bumped up a tax bracket, only the income above the previous bracket's threshold is taxed at the higher rate, not your entire income. Therefore, your take-home earnings will still increase, but not by the full amount of the raise due to the higher tax rate applied to the portion of income in the higher bracket.
